channel.title: Warner Archive Collection Podcast
channel.copyright: (c) 2011 Warner Bros. Entertainment, Inc. All Rights Reserved
channel.itunes:subtitle: A walk through the Golden Age of Hollywood.
channel.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
channel.itunes:summary: George Feltenstein hosts the Warner Archive Collection podcast, bringing you vintage radio dramas, interviews and weekly round-table discussions culled from the rich film and television history contained within the Warner Bros. vaults.
channel.description: George Feltenstein hosts the Warner Archive Collection podcast, bringing you vintage radio dramas, interviews and weekly round-table discussions culled from the rich film and television history contained within the Warner Bros. vaults.
channel.itunes:keywords: Audio Podcast, Warner Bros. Digital Distribution, Warner Archive Collection, Classic Films, Radio Broadcast, CECIL B. DeMILLE, LUX RADIO THEATER, Screen Guild, Leo Is On the Air

item.title: Chained - Starring Joan Crawford
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Cecil B. DeMille's Lux Radio Theater presentation of Chained starring Joan Crawford.
item.itunes:summary: A 1936 radio adaptation of the 1934 MGM film starring Joan Crawford in her original screen role as a woman caught in a romantic triangle.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, CHAINED, JOAN CRAWFORD, FRANCHOT TONE, CECIL B. DeMILLE, LUX RADIO THEATER

item.title: Young Tom Edison
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Cecil B. DeMille's Lux Radio Theater presentation of Young Tom Edison starring Mickey Rooney.
item.itunes:summary: A 1940 radio adaptation of the 1940 MGM film with Mickey Rooney portraying the legendary inventory Edison, during his formative years.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Young Tom Edison, MICKEY ROONEY, VIRGINIA WEIDLER, CECIL B. DeMILLE, Lux Radio Theater

item.title: Love on the Run
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Frank Whitbeck narrates a radio broadcast promoting Love on the Run
item.itunes:summary: A 1936 radio broadcast created by MGM to promote the release of the Joan Crawford and Clark Gable comedy LOVE ON THE RUN.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Love on the Run, CLARK GABLE, JOAN CRAWFORD, FRANK WHITBECK, Leo is On The Air

item.title: Mrs. Parkington
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Cecil B. DeMille's Lux Radio Theater presentation of Mrs. Parkington starring Greer Garson and Walter Pidgeon.
item.itunes:summary: A 1946 radio adaptation of the 1944 MGM film starring Greer Garson and Walter Pidgeon, with Garson as the titular character, whose life is traced from humble beginnings as a maid to her later years as a society matron.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Mrs. Parkington, GREER GARSON, WALTER PIDGEON, WILLIAM KEIGHLEY, CECIL B. DeMILLE, Lux Radio Theater

item.title: Abe Lincoln in Illinois
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Cecil B. DeMille's Lux Radio Theater presentation of Abe Lincoln in Illinois starring Raymond Massey.
item.itunes:summary: A radio adaptation of the 1940 film with Raymond Massey as the titular character. Here Mr. Massey recreates the role he initially created on stage and then film.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Abe Lincoln in Illinois, Raymond Massey, CECIL B. DeMILLE, Lux Radio Theater

item.title: Carbine Williams
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Hollywood Radio Theater presentation of Carbine Williams starring Ronald Reagan.
item.itunes:summary: A radio adaptation of the 1952 film that starred James Stewart. Here the role of Carbine Williams is played by future President of the United States, Ronald Reagan.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Carbine Williams, Ronald Reagan, Wendell Corey, Jean Hagen, Hollywood Radio Theater, MGM

item.title: Close To My Heart
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Cecil B. DeMille's Lux Radio Theater presentation of Close To My Heart starring Ray Milland and Phyllis Thaxter.
item.itunes:summary: A radio adaptation of the 1951 film that starred Ray Milland and Gene Tierney. Here the role of Midge is played by Phyllis Thaxter.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Close To My Heart, Ray Milland, Phyllis Thaxter, Gene Tierney, CECIL B. DeMILLE, Lux Radio Theater

item.title: The Shining Hour
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Good News of 1938 radio show presentation of The Shining Hour starring Joan Crawford and Margaret Sullavan.
item.itunes:summary: A radio adaptation of the 1938 film that starred Joan Crawford and Margaret Sullavan.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, The Shining Hour, Joan Crawford, Margaret Sullavan, Robert Young, Good News of 1938 radio show

item.title: The Citadel
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: MGM Theater of the Air radio presentation of The Citadel. This radio version of the 1938 film was recorded in 1949 and stars Fredric March and his wife Florence Eldridge.
item.itunes:summary: MGM Theater of the Air radio presentation of The Citadel. This radio version of the 1938 film was recorded in 1949 and stars Fredric March and his wife Florence Eldridge.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, The Citadel, Fredric March, Florence Eldridge, MGM Theater of the Air radio show

item.title: Dust Be My Destiny
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Cecil B. DeMille's Lux Radio Theater presentation of Dust Be My Destiny starring John Garfield.
item.itunes:summary: A 1941 radio adaptation of the 1939 film that starred John Garfield.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Dust Be My Destiny, John Garfield, CECIL B. DeMILLE, Lux Radio Theater

item.title: Johnny Eager
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Cecil B. DeMille's Lux Radio Theater presentation of Johnny Eager starring Robert Taylor and Van Heflin.
item.itunes:summary: Robert Taylor and Van Heflin returned from service in World War II to recreate their roles from the 1941 film noir classic in this 1946 Lux Theater radio presentation of Johnny Eager.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Johnny Eager, Robert Taylor, Van Heflin, film noir, CECIL B. DeMILLE, Lux Radio Theater

item.title: The Fallen Sparrow
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Cecil B. DeMille's Lux Radio Theater presentation of The Fallen Sparrow starring Robert Young and Maureen O'Hara.
item.itunes:summary: A 1944 radio adaptation of the 1943 film that originally starred John Garfield. Here the role of John "Kit" McKittrick is played by Robert Young. This presentation also stars Maureen O'Hara and Walter Slezak
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Fallen Sparrow, Robert Young, Maureen O'Hara, Walter Slezak, film noir, CECIL B. DeMILLE, Lux Radio Theater

item.title: The Ice Follies of 1939
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Good News of 1939 Radio Show presentation of The Ice Follies of 1939 starring Joan Crawford, James Stewart and Lew Ayres. Hosted by Robert Young.
item.itunes:summary: Good News of 1939 Radio Show presentation of The Ice Follies of 1939 starring Joan Crawford, James Stewart and Lew Ayres. Hosted by Robert Young.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, The Ice Follies of 1939, Joan Crawford, James Stewart, Robert Young, Good News of 1939 Radio Show

item.title: Forsaking All Others
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Cecil B. DeMille's Lux Radio Theater presentation of Forsaking All Others starring Bette Davis and Joel McCrea.
item.itunes:summary: A 1938 radio adaptation of the 1934 film that originally starred Joan Crawford and Robert Montgomery. Here the role of Mary Clay is played by Crawford screen rival Bette Davis. This presentation also stars Joel McCrea.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Forsaking All Others, Bette Davis, Joel McCrea, CECIL B. DeMILLE, Lux Radio Theater

item.title: On Borrowed Time
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Cecil B. DeMille's Lux Radio Theater presentation of On Borrowed Time starring Lionel Barrymore,Agnes Moorhead, Vincent Price and Ted Donaldson.
item.itunes:summary: A radio adaptation of the 1939 film that also starred Lionel Barrymore. This radio presentation also stars Agnes Moorhead, Vincent Price and Ted Donaldson.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, On Borrowed Time, Agnes Moorhead, Vincent Price, Lionel Barrymore, CECIL B. DeMILLE, Lux Radio Theater

item.title: Men In White
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Cecil B. DeMille's Lux Radio Theater presentation of Men In White starring Spencer Tracy, Virginia Bruce and Francis Farmer.
item.itunes:summary: A 1937 radio adaptation of the 1933 film that starred Clark Gable. In this radio presentation the role of Clark Gable is performed by Spencer Tracy. The radio play also stars Virginia Bruce and Francis Farmer.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Men In White, Spencer Tracy, Virginia Bruce, Francis Farmer, CECIL B. DeMILLE, Lux Radio Theater

item.title: Pride of the Marines
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Cecil B. DeMille's Lux Radio Theater presentation of Pride of the Marines starring John Garfield, Eleanor Parker and Dane Clark.
item.itunes:summary: A 1945 radio adaptation of the 1945 film that starred John Garfield. The stars from the original film, John Garfield, Eleanor Parker and Dane Clark, reprise their roles here for this Lux Radio Theater play. Stay tuned to the end for a very special guest.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Pride of the Marines, John Garfield, Eleanor Parker, Dane Clark, CECIL B. DeMILLE, Lux Radio Theater

item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution

item.itunes:summary: From 1940, a Screen Guild Players Radio Program presentation of Private Lives starring Laurence Olivier and Vivien Leigh.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Private Lives, Laurence Olivier, Vivien Leigh, Screen Guild Player Radio Program

item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Angie Dickinson reminisces about "Pretty Maids All in a Row," Jack Warner, her contract with Warner Bros., Tori Amos and "Ocean's Eleven."

item.title: James Best Interview
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: James Best discusses highlights from his illustrious acting career including his turn as Sheriff Rosco P. Coltrane from The Dukes of Hazzard and The Dukes Animated Series, as well as other great Warner Bros. television series and films.
item.itunes:summary: James Best discusses highlights from his illustrious acting career including his turn as Sheriff Rosco P. Coltrane from The Dukes of Hazzard and The Dukes Animated Series, other great Warner Bros. television series as well as Warner Archive films including First to Fight with co-star Gene Hackman and Samuel Fuller's Verboten.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, James Best, George Feltenstein, Samuel Fuller, The Dukes, Dukes of Hazzard, Gene Hackman

item.title: Vitaphone - Episode 1
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Fascinating early sound shorts from a bygone era.
item.itunes:summary: Fascinating early sound shorts from a bygone era featuring venerable vaudevillians, musical marvels, crazy comics and formidable character actors. This week's episode features the earliest Vitaphone recording from Jack Warner, as well as segments from The Revelers, The Gotham Rhythm Boys and Eddie White.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Vitaphone, Jack Warner, Eddie White, Gotham Rhythm Boys, Warner Bros, The Revelers

item.title: Peter Noone Interview
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Herman's Hermits' frontman, Peter Noone, discusses highlights from his acting and music career, and what it was like working in Los Angeles and London in the 1960's.
item.itunes:summary: Spend some time with Herman's Hermits' frontman, Peter Noone, as he discusses highlights from his acting and music career, and what it was like working in Los Angeles and London in the 1960's. Mr. Noone tells some great stories about how the band got their name, and stories from the sets of his films including Hold On! and Mrs. Brown, You've Got a Lovely Daughter - both, now available from the Warner Archive Collection.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Peter Noone, Hermans Hermits, Hold On, George Feltenstein, Mrs. Brown You've Got a Lovely Daughter

item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Whistling in Dixie, Red Skelton, Screen Guild Players, The Fox

item.itunes:subtitle: Efrem Zimbalist, Jr., discusses highlights from his acting career.
item.itunes:summary: Efrem Zimbalist, Jr., discusses highlights from his acting career, including stories of how he came to such iconic roles in 77 Sunset Strip and The F.B.I. - Also learn about the interesting connection that Mr. Zimbalist's father had with Warner Bros. in the early days of sound films.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Efrem Zimbalist, George Feltenstein, F.B.I., 77 Sunset Strip, Wait Until Dark

item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Stefanie Powers, The Girl From U.N.C.L.E., discusses highlights from her career with George Feltenstein in commemoration of the Warner Archive Collections' release of The Girl From U.N.C.L.E.
item.itunes:summary: Stefanie Powers, The Girl From U.N.C.L.E., discusses highlights from her career, and reminisces with George Feltenstein. Listen to Ms. Powers tell stories from her amazing career including what it was like working as a contract actor within the studio system as well as some memories of fellow Hollywood greats like Boris Karloff, Peggy Lee and Yvonne De Carlo.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Stefanie Powers, Girl From U.N.C.L.E., George Feltenstein, Warner Bros

item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: Brandon Cruz, Eddie, from The Courtship of Eddie's Father, discusses highlights from his career with George Feltenstein in commemoration of the Warner Archive Collections' release of The Courtship of Eddie's Father - The Complete First Season.
item.itunes:summary: Brandon Cruz, Eddie, from The Courtship of Eddie's Father, discusses highlights from his career , and reminisces with George Feltenstein. Listen to Mr. Cruz tell stories about his amazing childhood experiences that include what it was like auditioning for and working with Bill Bixby as well as some memories of other Hollywood and rock-and-roll greats of the day like Elvis Presley, Harry Nilsson, and John Lennon. This is Part 1 of a two part interview.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, Brandon Cruz, Dr. Know, The Courtship of Eddie's Father, George Feltenstein, Bill Bixby, Elvis Presley, Harry Nilsson, John Lennon,Warner Bros

item.itunes:summary: Brandon Cruz, Eddie, from The Courtship of Eddie's Father, discusses highlights from his career , and reminisces with George Feltenstein. In Part 2, Mr. Cruz tells us about the miraculous twists and turns his life has taken since filming The Courtship of Eddie's Father.

item.itunes:summary: Mickey Rooney is a true icon of the silver screen, and has starred in countless classics since the earliest days of Hollywood. George Feltenstein recently had the honor of spending some time with Mr. Rooney and we look forward to sharing that interview with his fans. item.title: New Releases: Jungles, Strawberries and Psychos!
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, the Warner Archive Collection crew take us through seven new releases ranging from Tarzan to psychological thrillers and from campus unrest to World War II era patriotic propaganda.
item.itunes:summary: This week, the Warner Archive Collection crew take us through seven new releases, starting with the late '60's Tarzan TV show and on to the '70's for the campus unrest classic The Strawberry Statement and the seldom seen psycho-thriller, The Spiral Staircase. We then head back to the '40's for the psychological thriller Rage in Heaven starring Ingrid Bergman and Joan of Paris, a suspense actioner about wartime France starring her Casablanca co-star, Paul Henreid. Then we finish our discussion with two offerings with Ann Sothern, Hooray for Love and Panama Hattie.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, George Feltenstein, Matthew Patterson, Daniel Ferranti, Warner Archive Collection, New Releases

item.title: New Releases: Murder, Music and Shazzan!
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, the Warner Archive Collection crew take us through nine new releases ranging from Hanna-Barbera's Shazzan to Musicals and Mysteries from the '30's and '40's.
item.itunes:summary: This week, the Warner Archive Collection crew take us through nine new releases starting with Hanna-Barbera's 1967's Shazzan, remastered and better than ever. Next we discuss musicals from the late '30's and '40's including Big City, Beat the Band and Hitting a New High. Mysteries include Bewitched, While the Patient Slept and The Case of the Black Parrot. Rounding out this week are two brisk actioners, Smashing the Rackets and Truck Busters. Now, who you gonna call?
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, George Feltenstein, Matthew Patterson, Daniel Ferranti, Warner Archive Collection, New Releases

item.title: New Releases: Westward The Wellman and More!
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, the Warner Archive Collection crew take us through twelve new wonderful rediscoveries ranging from Westerns to Drama and Classic Comedies.
item.itunes:summary: This week, the Warner Archive Collection crew take us through twelve new releases starting with William Wellman's 1951 film, Westward the Women, complete with multiple Special Features. Next we discuss some great rediscoveries like Bright Road , Exclusive Story, Clear All Wires! I'll Wait For You, Three Loves Has Nancy, If Winter Comes, Tish, and The Desperate Search. Rounding out this week's releases are three comedies, Penrod and Sam, Penrod's Double Trouble and a Yank at Eton starring Micky Rooney.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, George Feltenstein, Matthew Patterson, Daniel Ferranti, Warner Archive Collection, New Releases

item.itunes:summary: This week, the Warner Archive Collection crew talk about nine new releases including four with Lon Chaney: The Black Bird, West of Zanzibar, Where East is East and Tell it to the Marines. item.title: New Releases: Let My People Go-Go
item.itunes:author: Warner Bros. Digital Distribution
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, the Warner Archive Collection bunch chat about five wildly different new releases from the mid-30's to the late 60's.
item.itunes:summary: This week, the Warner Archive Collection bunch chat about five wildly different new releases spanning from the mid-30's to the late 60's including 1935's STAR OF MIDNIGHT with Ginger Rogers, HULLABALOO with Frank Morgan, THIS COULD BE THE NIGHT directed by Robert Wise, 1961's BRIDGE TO THE SUN and finishing off with 1969's FLAREUP featuring Raquel Welch.
item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, George Feltenstein, Matthew Patterson, Daniel Ferranti, Raquel Welch, Ginger Rogers, Frank Morgan, Warner Archive Collection, New Releases

item.itunes:summary: This week, the Warner Archive Collection group talk about three new releases including THE MAISIE COLLECTION VOLUME 1 with five Maisie movies: MAISIE, CONGO MAISIE, GOLD RUSH MAISIE, MAISIE WAS A LADY and RINGSIDE MAISIE. item.itunes:keywords: AUDIO PODCAST, George Feltenstein, Matthew Patterson, Daniel Ferranti, Ann Sothern, Warner Archive Collection, New Releases
